availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas P. Cain (Louisville, Jefferson County, dry goods merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, dry goods merchant. Pennsylvania native. Married to Eliza Hagan Cain in Washington County, Kentucky, on May 19, 1857. Father of James Cain and Mary Cain. Dry Goods Merchant in Jefferson County in 1860. Dry Goods Merchant in partnership with Thomas Slevin and Richard D. Slevin in T. & R. Slevin & Cain in Jefferson County from 1854 to 1877. Employed Margrett Sprechue in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 6, p. 251.
